sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都可表示"装饰图案"之意。
means: figure ： 指呈现于整个表面的简单的几何图形或小型图案。
pattern ： 一般指简单的重复图案，或整个装饰的格调或事物的布局，也指由一些相连图形拼成的较大图案。
design ： 专指线条、轮廓、图案。强调设计的完美或有秩序。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"形式"或"外形"之意。
means: form ： 最普通用词，含义广，既可指客观物体的外形，又可用于抽象概念的"形"。
figure ： 指轮廓、外形，尤指体态，相貌或身体。
shape ： 通常指由线和面所围成的外观上的形，侧重立体形状。
outline ： 指任何形状的轮廓线。

sentence.Network_en: They had almost reached the boat when a figure shot past them.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们差不多快到船边时，一个人影从他们旁边飞奔而过。

sentence.Network_en: Alistair saw the dim figure of Rose in the chair.
sentence.Network_cn: 阿利斯泰尔看见了坐在椅子里的罗丝的模糊身影。

sentence.Network_en: I don't have to be a detective to figure that out.

a word or phrase used in a non-literal sense to add rhetorical force or interest to a spoken or written passage

jx.jx_en_mean: give a price or exact number for
jx.jx_cn_mean: 给…定价（或提供确切数字）

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer. informal)count or rely on something happening or being the case in the future

lj.lj_ly: anyone thinking of salmon fishing should figure on paying $200 a day.

jx.jx_en_mean: To include, as in making an account

lj.lj_ls: 我们就指望你的支持了

lj.lj_ly: I figured on an hour's delay.
We figure on leaving at noon.
Let's figure out a way to help.
lj.lj_ls: 让我们来找出帮助的办法吧

lj.lj_ly: Can you figure out this puzzle?

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the senses 'distinctive shape of a person or thing', 'representation of something material or immaterial', and 'numerical symbol', among others): from Old French figure (noun), figurer (verb), from Latin figura 'shape, figure, form'; related to fingere 'form, contrive'

entry.def: A figure is a particular amount expressed as a number, especially a statistic.

example.ex: It would be very nice if we had a true figure of how many people in this country haven't got a job...
example.tran: 如果我们能得到该国失业人口的真实数字就好了。

example.ex: It will not be long before the inflation figure starts to fall...
example.tran: 过不了多久，通货膨胀率就会开始下降。

entry.tran: (0 到 9 的)数字符号，数目字
entry.def: A figure is any of the ten written symbols from 0 to 9 that are used to represent a number.

An amount or number that is in single figures is between zero and nine. An amount or number that is in double figures is between ten and ninety-nine. You can also say, for example, that an amount or number is in three figures when it is between one hundred and nine hundred and ninety-nine.

example.ex: Inflation, which has usually been in single figures, is running at more than 12%...
example.tran: 通常保持在个位数的通货膨胀率现在已超过了 12％。

example.ex: Crawley, with 14, was the only other player to reach double figures...
example.tran: 克劳利拿到 14 分,是仅有的另外一个得分达两位数的球员。

entry.def: You refer to someone that you can see as a figure when you cannot see them clearly or when you are describing them.

example.ex: Alistair saw the dim figure of Rose in the chair...
example.tran: 阿利斯泰尔看见了坐在椅子里的罗丝的模糊身影。

example.ex: She waited, standing on the bridge, until his figure vanished against the grey backdrop of the Palace...
example.tran: 她站在桥上，一直等到他的身影消失在宫殿灰色的阴影中。

entry.tran: (绘画作品中的)人物;雕像;塑像
entry.def: In art, a figure is a person in a drawing or a painting, or a statue of a person.

example.ex: ...a life-size bronze figure of a brooding, hooded woman.
example.tran: 一个戴着兜帽作沉思状的真人大小青铜女子雕像

entry.def: Your figure is the shape of your body.

example.ex: Take pride in your health and your figure...
example.tran: 为自己的健康和体形感到骄傲吧。

example.ex: Janet was a natural blonde with a good figure.
example.tran: 珍妮特天生一头金发，身材曼妙。

entry.def: Someone who is referred to as a figure of a particular kind is a person who is well-known and important in some way.

example.ex: The movement is supported by key figures in the three main political parties.
example.tran: 这个运动受到三大政党关键人物的支持。

entry.def: If you say that someone is, for example, a mother figure or a hero figure, you mean that other people regard them as the type of person stated or suggested.

example.ex: Sometimes young lads just need to turn to a mother figure for a bit of a chat and reassurance.
example.tran: 有时候年轻小伙子只是需要找一个母亲式的人物聊一聊，从中获得安慰。

example.ex: Daniel Boone, the great hero figure of the frontier...
example.tran: 丹尼尔·布恩——西部伟大的英雄形象

entry.def: In books and magazines, the diagrams which help to show or explain information are referred to as figures .

example.ex: If you look at a world map (see Figure 1) you can identify the major wine-producing regions...
example.tran: 查一查世界地图(见图1)，就能找到主要的葡萄酒产区。

example.ex: Figure 1.15 shows which provinces lost populations between 1910 and 1920.
example.tran: 表 1.15 显示出哪些省份在 1910 至 1920 年间人口减少了。

entry.def: In geometry, a figure is a shape, especially a regular shape.

example.ex: Draw a pentagon, a regular five-sided figure.
example.tran: 画个五边形，一个规则的五边形。

entry.def: If you figure that something is the case, you think or guess that it is the case.

example.ex: She figured that both she and Ned had learned a lot from the experience.
example.tran: 她觉得自己和内德都从这一经历中学到了很多东西。

entry.tran: 不奇怪;很正常;合乎情理
entry.def: If you say 'That figures' or 'It figures', you mean that the fact referred to is not surprising.

example.ex: When I finished, he said, 'Yeah. That figures'...
example.tran: 等我说完，他说道：“是啊，那是预料中事。”

example.ex: Work it out and you'll find it figures.
example.tran: 弄明白了你就会觉得这合情合理。

entry.def: If a person or thing figures in something, they appear in or are included in it.

example.ex: Human rights violations figured prominently in the report.
example.tran: 有关侵犯人权的部分在报告中占据了显要地位。

entry.def: If you say that someone cuts a particular figure, you mean that they appear to other people in the way described.

example.ex: Today she cuts a lonely figure.
example.tran: 今天她看起来十分孤独。

entry.def: If you describe someone as a figure of fun, you mean that people think they are ridiculous.

example.ex: The man has become an unlikely figure of fun.
example.tran: 令人想象不到的是，这个男人已经成为了笑谈。

entry.def: If you keep your figure, you stay thin. If you lose your figure, you become rather fat.

example.ex: You'll lose your girlish figure if you don't watch out.
example.tran: 如果不多加注意，你就会失去女孩般的苗条身段。

entry.tran: 说出…的确切数量(或数目)
entry.def: When you put a figure on an amount, you say exactly how much it is.

example.ex: No one will put a figure on the final cost of this reconstruction.
example.tran: 谁也不愿确切地说明这一重建最后总共的花费是多少。

entry.def: If you figure on something, you plan that it will happen or assume that it will happen when making your plans.

example.ex: Jack worked as hard as he could to build his business, but he hadn't figured on a few obstacles.
example.tran: 杰克竭尽全力发展自己的公司，但有几个障碍是他始料不及的。

entry.def: If you figure out a solution to a problem or the reason for something, you succeed in solving it or understanding it.

example.ex: It took them about one month to figure out how to start the equipment...
example.tran: 他们花了大约1个月的时间才搞清楚如何启动设备。

example.ex: They're trying to figure out the politics of this whole situation...
example.tran: 他们正试图弄明白整个情形背后的权术争斗。

entry.def: If you figure up a cost or amount, you add numbers together to get the total.

example.ex: He figured up the balance in their checking account.
example.tran: 他算出了他们活期存款账户上的余额总和。

means.word_mean: 1. a diagram or picture illustrating textual material;

sentences.sentence: "the area covered can be seen from Figure 2"

means.word_mean: 2. alternative names for the body of a human being;

sentences.sentence: "Leonardo studied the human body"
"he has a strong physique"
"the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak"

means.word_mean: 3. one of the elements that collectively form a system of numbers;

sentences.sentence: "0 and 1 are digits"

means.word_mean: 4. a model of a bodily form (especially of a person);

sentences.sentence: "he made a figure of Santa Claus"

means.word_mean: 5. a well-known or notable person;

sentences.sentence: "they studied all the great names in the history of France"
"she is an important figure in modern music"

means.word_mean: 6. a combination of points and lines and planes that form a visible palpable shape
7. an amount of money expressed numerically;

sentences.sentence: "a figure of $17 was suggested"

means.word_mean: 8. the impression produced by a person;

sentences.sentence: "he cut a fine figure"
"a heroic figure"

means.word_mean: 9. the property possessed by a sum or total or indefinite quantity of units or individuals;

sentences.sentence: "he had a number of chores to do"
"the number of parameters is small"
"the figure was about a thousand"

means.word_mean: 10. language used in a figurative or nonliteral sense
11. a unitary percept having structure and coherence that is the object of attention and that stands out against a ground
12. a decorative or artistic work;

sentences.sentence: "the coach had a design on the doors"

means.word_mean: 13. a predetermined set of movements in dancing or skating;

sentences.sentence: "she made the best score on compulsory figures"

means.word_mean: 1. judge to be probable
2. be or play a part of or in;

sentences.sentence: "Elections figure prominently in every government program"
"How do the elections figure in the current pattern of internal politics?"

means.word_mean: 3. imagine; conceive of; see in one's mind;

sentences.sentence: "I can't see him on horseback!"
"I can see what will happen"
"I can see a risk in this strategy"

means.word_mean: 4. make a mathematical calculation or computation
5. understand;

sentences.sentence: "He didn't figure her"

stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+figure轮廓+ation表名词→所有的轮廓放在一起→总的结构
fig做,制作+ment物→做出来的东西
fig做,制作+ure表名词→做出的状态,形状
fig做,制作+ure表名词→做出的状态,形状

Sentence.sentence: Just when you had figured out how to manage fat in your diet, researchers are now warning against another common mealtime pitfall (陷阱) — salt.
SAT scores began dropping in 1963;today,on average,30% of students do not complete high school in four years, a figure that rises to 50% in poor urban neighborhoods.
What do we learn from the passage about the unemployment figures in the U.S.?.S.?
By recapturing the attempt of the monarch and noting where they came from, the next scientist can figure out things like butterfly's age and its routing
As they walk around a playground or other area, text, video or audio pops up at various points to help them try to figure out why aliens were in the schoolyard
Collectively, we rely on the unemployment figures and other statistics to frame our sense of reality.

sentences.en: The above figure did not include workers.
sentences.cn: 上面的数字没有包括工人。

sentences.cn: 第22页的插图是非洲的政区图。

means.word_mean: 人或动物的像, 画像, 肖像

means.word_mean: 轮廓, 人影, 身材, 体态, 风姿

sentences.en: I made out three figures moving in the distance.
sentences.cn: 我隐约看出远处有三个人影在移动。

means.word_mean: 算术, 计算
出现, 被提及

sentences.en: His name figured among the guests.
sentences.cn: 宾客名单中有他的名字。

means.word_mean: (突出地)出现，出名，露头角，惹人注目，醒目，突出

sentences.en: His name figures in my report.
sentences.cn: 他的名字在我的报告中很突出。

means.word_mean: 做算术，计算，演算

sentences.en: The boy was figured on a blackboard.
sentences.cn: 这男孩在黑板上做算术。

means.word_mean: 计算在内

sentences.en: Figure the total and I'll pay it with a cheque.
sentences.cn: 请把总数算出来, 我用支票支付。

means.word_mean: 估计, 有可能; 认为, 料想

sentences.en: I figured that you wouldn't come.
He figured himself as a good candidate.
sentences.cn: 他认为自己是合适的人选。

means.word_mean: (以图画或图表)描绘；描述；塑造

sentences.en: The sculptor figured the girl in clay.
sentences.cn: 雕塑家用粘土塑造了这个女孩子的形象。

jushi.english: The approximate figure is 40, while the exact number is 38.
A sculptor may see different figures implicit in a block of stone.
jushi.chinese: 雕塑家可能会看到一块石头中潜在的不同形象。
你能核对一下这些数字吗?
